org.spongepowered.api.service.permission

Class MemorySubjectData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.service.permission.MemorySubjectData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubjectData

    public class MemorySubjectData
extends Object
implements SubjectData
    A subject data implementation storing all contained data in memory.

    This class is thread-safe.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.service.permission.SubjectData

        GLOBAL_CONTEXT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemorySubjectData(PermissionService service)
      Creates a new subject data instance, using the provided service to request instances of permission subjects.

        Return all permissions associated with this data object.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getNodeTree

        public NodeTree getNodeTree(Set<Context> contexts)
        Gets the calculated node tree representation of the permissions for this subject data instance. If no data is present for the given context, returns null.
        Parameters:
        contexts - The contexts to get a node tree for
        Returns:
        The node tree

      • getPermissions

        public Map<String,Boolean> getPermissions(Set<Context> contexts)
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Returns the list of permissions set for the given context.

        This list is immutable and is not a live view. If no permissions have been set, it returns an empty list.

        Specified by:
        getPermissions in interface SubjectData
        Parameters:
        contexts - The particular context combination to check
        Returns:
        Any permissions set

      • setPermission

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> setPermission(Set<Context> contexts,
                                                String permission,
                                                Tristate value)
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Sets a permission to a given value.

        Setting value as Tristate.UNDEFINED unsets the permission.

        An empty set of contexts applies this permission to the global context.

        Specified by:
        setPermission in interface SubjectData
        Parameters:
        contexts - The particular combination of contexts to set this permission in
        permission - The permission to set
        value - The value to set this permission to
        Returns:
        Whether the operation was successful

      • clearPermissions

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> clearPermissions(Set<Context> context)
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Clear all permissions set in a given context combination.

        Passing an empty context set clears permissions in the global context.

        Returns:

      • getAllParents

        public Map<Set<Context>,List<SubjectReference>> getAllParents()
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Return all registered parent subjects for all contexts.

        The returned map is immutable and not a live view. The results of this method do not traverse any sort of inheritance structure a permissions plugin may implement.

        Specified by:
        getAllParents in interface SubjectData
        Returns:
        All registered parents and the context they are registered in

      • getParents

        public List<SubjectReference> getParents(Set<Context> contexts)
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Return all registered parent subjects for a given context.

        The returned map is immutable and not a live view. The results of this method do not traverse any sort of inheritance structure a permissions plugin may implement.

        Specified by:
        getParents in interface SubjectData
        Parameters:
        contexts - The context to check
        Returns:
        names of parents valid in the given context

      • addParent

                                            SubjectReference parent)
        Description copied from interface: SubjectData
        Adds a parent in a particular context combination.

        Passing an empty context combination means the parent is added in the global context.

        parent - The name of the parent to add
